name: Maestro Labs Notetaker Free
summary_and_recommendation: TeamsMaestro Free poses medium risk due to unclear AI training data usage policies, limited enterprise controls in the free tier, and data processing outside controlled jurisdictions. The tool automatically captures meeting audio and transcripts, which could include sensitive information. While the vendor shows good compliance posture with SOC 2 Type II certification, the free tier lacks enterprise-grade admin controls and audit capabilities. Recommend: Approve for general use only with public/marketing content meetings. Requires enterprise account upgrade for meetings with sensitive data.
primary_use_case: AI meeting note-taking and transcription for Microsoft Teams
data_classification: Meeting content, audio recordings, transcripts, personally identifiable information
documentation_tier: Tier 1: Public documentation with detailed privacy policy
assessment_notes: Good confidence level based on comprehensive privacy policy and public documentation. Some enterprise features unclear for free tier specifically.

recommended_restrictions: Block access to sensitive meeting rooms

recommendations.title: Upgrade to Enterprise Account
recommendations.description: For meetings with sensitive data, upgrade to enterprise account to access better admin controls and potential data retention customization

recommendations.title: Meeting Content Guidelines
recommendations.description: Establish clear guidelines on which meetings can use AI note-taking tools based on content sensitivity

recommendations.title: Data Retention Monitoring
recommendations.description: Regular review of stored meeting data and deletion of sensitive content where possible

detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: TeamsMaestro Free poses medium risk due to unclear AI training data usage policies, limited enterprise controls in the free tier, and data processing outside controlled jurisdictions. The tool automatically captures meeting audio and transcripts, which could include sensitive information. While the vendor shows good compliance posture with SOC 2 Type II certification, the free tier lacks enterprise-grade admin controls and audit capabilities. Recommend: Approve for general use only with public/marketing content meetings. Requires enterprise account upgrade for meetings with sensitive data.

geographic_control.justification: Known secure regions (US, EU) with contracts - Privacy policy states data is stored in United States and European Union with appropriate safeguards including standard data protection clauses under GDPR Article 46.

encryption_standards.justification: Enterprise-Grade Encryption - Documentation states 'encrypting data in transit and at rest' with vendor-managed keys and published encryption specifications, though detailed technical specs not publicly available.

data_retention.justification: Extended Retention - Privacy policy states retention periods vary based on type of data and contractual agreements with some service data retained for longer periods, though specific timeframes not clearly defined for free tier users.

model_training.justification: Default training use with difficult opt-out - Privacy policy states they share email content and user instructions with third-party AI models for service provision, with no clear opt-out mechanism documented for free tier users.

data_sharing.justification: Broad sharing or unclear sharing practices - Privacy policy indicates sharing with third-party AI services and mentions data may be anonymized 'depending on the language and processing requirements' but lacks specific details on data sharing boundaries.

admin_management.justification: Limited Controls - Free tier appears to provide user visibility and basic management capabilities but lacks comprehensive enterprise admin dashboard and role-based permissions found in enterprise accounts.

audit_capabilities.justification: Good Auditing - Privacy policy mentions data processing agreements and tracking capabilities, though specific audit log details not fully documented for free tier.

integration.justification: Full Enterprise Integration - Native Microsoft Teams integration with OAuth authentication, seamless Microsoft 365 integration, and API access capabilities documented.

regulatory_violations.justification: Mostly Compliant - Privacy policy states SOC 2 Type II certification, GDPR compliance, and Microsoft attestation, with signed Data Processing Agreements available, though some specialized compliance gaps may exist.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Basic Transparency - Privacy policy provides general data processing descriptions with retention periods stated and some third-party relationships disclosed, but lacks detailed data flow diagrams.

documentation_and_support.justification: Minimal Documentation - Standard privacy policy with limited security documentation details publicly available, though support contact information is provided and vendor appears responsive based on recent policy updates.
